dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise’s mom and grandma, CATHERINE and ERNESTINE, are wi Catherine's friend, JOYCE. They’re prepping for Thanksgiv dinner while watching the Price is Right.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Where Denise at?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: She’s upstairs with her little boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Oh, wait, Denise got a little boyfriend?!

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm. Two kids, around age 8, run in. It’s KID DEV and KID DENI Denise is dressed femininely and conservatively.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Y’all better stop running through this house.

dialogues.speaker: KID DENISE
dialogues.text: Yes, Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Denise, what were y'all doing up there?

dialogues.speaker: KID DENISE
dialogues.text: Watching Fresh Prince.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: You weren’t eating candy, were you?

dialogues.speaker: KID DENISE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Dev, do y'all even celebrate Thanksgiving in your house? Is that a thing y’all do in the Indian community?

dialogues.speaker: KID DEV
dialogues.text: We have lunch together. Then my dad watches The Godfather and falls asleep.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Well, you are welcome to come have Thanksgiving with us anytime you want. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 2. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: KID DENISE
dialogues.text: What’s “the Indian community”?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Dev is Indian.

dialogues.speaker: KID DENISE
dialogues.text: Wait... I thought Dev was black.

dialogues.speaker: KID DEV
dialogues.text: I’m brown!

dialogues.speaker: KID DENISE
dialogues.text: Black people are brown too!

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh lord. Okay, look, both of you are minorities.

dialogues.speaker: KID DENISE
dialogues.text: What’s a minority?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: It’s a group of people that have to work twice as hard in life to get half as far. And Denise, you a black woman, so you gonna have to work three times as hard.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: I know that’s right.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm. You’re both gonna be disenfranchised. Ma.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: I’m coming.

dialogues.speaker: KID DENISE
dialogues.text: Like a McDonald's?

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KID DENISE
dialogues.text: McDonald’s is a franchise. When people open up their own McDonald's, they just pay the big McDonald’s man a license fee so they can run it. That’s what a franchise is. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 3. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Denise, how the hell do you know what a franchise is, but you don’t know that Dev ain’t black?

dialogues.speaker: KID DEV
dialogues.text: I’m confused. I’m a McDonald’s? Catherine is exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: You're a McDonald's and Denise is a Burger King. Now, both of y’all sit on down so we can get ready to eat. Denise and Dev sit at the table.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: And I’m a big old White Castle, so... Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ooh, this looks good.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: We gonna say grace first.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Oh. OPENING CREDITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine, Ernestine, and Joyce do their Thanksgiving pre circa 1995.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Ooh, tell your mama to stop smoking in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Child, I’m old. I can smoke wherever I want.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Dropping ashes all in the potatoes...

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: It adds flavor.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: I don’t want no Newport potatoes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 4. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: I was trying to help. INT. WATKINS FAMILY APARTMENT —- PRE-TEEN DENISE’S ROOM - 1995

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOT: A music video on a small TV in Denise’s room: “Brown Sugar” by D’Angelo. Pull out to REVEAL: PRE-TEEN DEV and PRE-TEEN DENISE are older, around 12. Dev is wearing a suit. They are dancing having fun. There are posters on the wall of Jasmine Guy, Jennifer Aniston, Hilary from Fresh Prince, Whitney Houst

dialogues.speaker: PRE-TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: (singing) “Skin is caramel/ With the cocoa eyes/ Even got a big sister by the name of Chocolate Thai.” Catherine opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: PRE-TEEN DEV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (singing) “Brown sugar baaaabe, I get high off your love, don’t know how to behave.”

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: What are y’all doing in here? Dev, now, what you know bout brown sugar. You’re 12 years old. You still got some of your baby teeth. Now y’all ain’t got no business listening to these songs. Look at Denise over there, staring at D’Angelo. Cut to the TV. Denise is actually staring at the woman in video. Catherine hangs a pink, fluffy dress on Denise’s closet door.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Denise, put on your dress so you can look nice for dinner. Denise looks at the dress, skeptical. INT. WATKINS FAMILY APARTMENT - PRE-TEEN DENISE’S ROOM -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise has the dress on, she looks at herself in the mirr She makes a disgusted face.

dialogues.speaker: PRE-TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Man, this is some bullshit.  MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 5. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: Dev and the family are downstairs. Denise comes down dres “Denise style” but in kids mode - blue jean overalls, Cro Colors shirt, and some LA Gear sneakers. She walks downst in slow motion as “Flava in Ya Ear (remix)” by Craig Mack

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Denise, that does not look like the clothes I picked out for you! What happened to that nice dress?

dialogues.speaker: PRE-TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: It didn't fit right!

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: You better make it fit.

dialogues.speaker: PRE-TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Why can’t I just wear this? It’s just us. Arsenio ain’t coming?

dialogues.speaker: PRE-TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Arsenio is coming?!

dialogues.speaker: PRE-TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Catherine, let that child wear what she wanna wear. And you watch your tone.

dialogues.speaker: PRE-TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Thanks, Aunt Joyce.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: All right, Ernestine, hurry up and say this prayer.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jesus, for bringing all our family together in one room for another Watkins family Thanksgiving. I want to bless all the hands that made the food. I want to bless the family that’s here today. I also want to bless the extended family that’s here, little Dev. I also want to bless--

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: We got it. God is able. Jesus wept. Can we please talk about 0.J.? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 6. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: I don’t know what we gonna talk about. He didn’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: PRE-TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: What about all that blood? How you know, Grandma?

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I just know!

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Ooh, if Nicole was black, we wouldn't even be talking about this.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: I know that’s right.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Honey, they are always trying take down our black icons.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Look at Michael!

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: I still don’t believe he touched them kids.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Child, anytime these folks see a black man coming up in the world, making himself enough money to get himself a white woman, they try to frame him.

dialogues.speaker: PRE-TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: What about Clarence Thomas?

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Fuck his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine and Ernestine prep for Thanksgiving. Time has advanced a few years, circa 1999. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 7. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: You didn’t put no parsnips in that dressing, did you?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: No, Mama. No parsnips.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: That's my least favorite vegetable. I hate them suckers. 9 INT. WATKINS FAMILY APARTMENT - TEEN DENISE’S ROOM — DA 1999 TEEN DENISE and TEEN DEV, around age 16, playing cards. Denise is wearing baggy clothes, Tommy Hilfiger, FUBU. A version of current Denise attire.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Man, I told you this is stupid. You can’t play spades with two people.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: I’m trying to make it work. You wanted to play spades. Let’s see if Aunt Joyce wants to play.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: She got a gambling problem. She can’t be around playing cards no more. Teen Denise puts her cards down. TEEN DENISE (CONT’D) Hey, could I talk to you about something?

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: You know Erica?

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: White Erica or black Erica?

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Nah, mixed Erica.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, I know mixed Erica. She’s cute.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Nah, mixed Erica’s fine as hell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 8. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: That's what I’m trying to say. Like... I like her. I have a crush on her.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Wait, are you trying to tell me that you're... you know?

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Lebanese.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: What? You’re from Lebanon?

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: No. I just-- I don’t know how to-- I’m not comfortable with the word, uh... (quietly) Lesbian.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: All right. So we’ll say you’re Lebanese. I mean, I always thought there was a good chance. You’re the only girl who wore Jordans to the Spring Fling. And you got those Jasmine Guy posters up for years. I always felt like it wasn’t about her acting.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: And I have been dressing like Da Brat since preschool.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: You gonna tell your mom?

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Being gay isn’t exactly something black people love to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Some black people think being gay’s a choice. And when they find out that their kid is gay, they try to figure out what they did wrong. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9 10 11 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 9. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Gay Martin’s white. His parents did the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it’s more intense for black folks. All right, so everything's a contest for us, and your kids are like trophies. Me being gay is like tarnishing her trophy.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: I don’t think being Lebanese tarnishes the trophy. There’s plenty of straight trophies. I think it’s cool you're a Lebanese trophy.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Thanks, dude.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Damn, this has been an intense talk. (beat) You want to smoke some weed? I got some shit that’s DANK. Teen Dev pulls out a ziplock bag with the tiniest amount the saddest-looking weed you have ever seen. INT. WATKINS FAMILY APARTMENT - TEEN DENISE’S ROOM — DAY 1999

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: Musical Youth - Pass the Dutchie. STYLIZED MONTAGE: Teen Dev and Teen Denise are smoking we and blowing the smoke through a paper towel roll with a d sheet in it, into the fan. INT. WATKINS FAMILY APARTMENT - TEEN DENISE’S ROOM — DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teen Dev is spacing out in front of a psychedelic poster.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Are you sure I’m supposed to see a dolphin? I don’t see a dolphin. Teen Denise is lying on her bed, lost in a poster of Jenn Anniston pasted to her ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, man. I’m in another world right now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 10. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Denise? Dev?

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Oh shit! I thought she was going to the store.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Me too! Be cool!

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: I’m cool! You be cool!

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: 12 Shut up! 12 Teen Denise and Teen Dev unpause a video game and act lik they have been playing.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: What y’all up to? Catherine enters.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Hi Ms. Watk -- AHHHHHHH!!! REVEAL: Catherine has a white cream mask on. Her face is covered in white goop.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: What the hell, ma?!

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: It's just a hydrating mask. You know I got a dry T-zone! What you freaking out for?

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: We freaking out ‘cause you’re coming in here looking like Dead Presidents! Teen Dev is scared. TEEN DENISE (CONT’D) You're supposed to be at the store. Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was going. Shoot, Joyce say she can handle it. (beat) Dev, how are your parents? They good? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pink Revision Pages

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Catherine NONE “Thanksgiving” (2)

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I heard y’all were going to Hawaii for Christmas. You excited?

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: (beat) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Well, this has been a stimulating conversation.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Okay, bye, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Uh-uh.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: Bye, okay?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Girl, don't be telling me where I can go in my own house. Don’t you be telling me where I can go in my own house. (beat) Are you all right? ‘Cause I swear, y’all look a little spaced out.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: We're just tired!

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. All right, I’m leaving. I’1l see y'all later for dinner. (leaving the room) You really need to clean all this up. I’ma give this to the Goodwill, somebody who appreciate it. exits.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DEV
dialogues.text: D-did I seem too high? Was that-- was I cool? [208] 11. 10/19/16 11 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 14 15 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: TEEN DENISE
dialogues.text: We cool. I’ma just kick it with Jen real quick. Denise lies back down on her bed to stare at the poster.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DINER _- DAY
dialogues.text: Time has advanced a few years, Thanksgiving morning circa 12. 11 14 15 2006. Denise (now played by Lena) is home from college. S wearing a hoodie and sweatpants. REVEAL: Denise is with Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: How are you this tall and you don’t play basketball?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I know, it sucks.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: A basketball scholarship would’ve come in real handy right now. But, I’m just glad you in college and you ain’t pregnant and on drugs.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: You don’t got to worry about me getting pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Why? You got that UID thing? Denise is grossed out by the thought.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Okay, first of all, it’s not a UID. Okay? It’s not a thing. It’s the IUD.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: But you ain’t got to worry about me and pregnancy.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: (beat) You got saved. You done come to the Lord.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: No. I don’t know why you keep asking me that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 13. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 15 Catherine shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not... gonna get pregnant because... I don’t like having sex with men. Catherine takes this in. It’s not a shock but it’s still moment.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Have you tried it?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Then how do you know you don’t like it?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: It's just something I know.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: (beat) Well, what you trying to say? Denise seems annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s is the problem?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I’m just annoyed that I even have to have this conversation with you.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: What conversation? I’m sitting here being normal. You acting like a crazy person.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Ma?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I’m gay. Catherine looks around the restaurant wondering if anyone heard her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: You what? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 14. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I’m gay. Denise can tell her mom’s uncomfortable and a little embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve always been gay. Catherine is still at a loss for words.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I’m still the same person. I’m still your daughter. Nothing’s changed. Denise sees there are tears in her mother’s eyes. This, o course, breaks her heart.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? Ma, why are you crying?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mm-mm. Mm-mm.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just-- I don’t want life to be hard for you. (beat) It is hard enough being a black woman in this world. Now you want add something else to that?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: It’s not like this was my choice. It’s just who I am.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Well, who else you done told?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Just Dev.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course. (then) You know you can’t tell your grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: “Cause she won’t be able to handle this. And you know forgetful she is. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 15. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re gonna have to come out to her every other week.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: True. She do be forgetting stuff. Catherine sighs. 16 INT. WATKINS FAMILY APARTMENT - COLLEGE DENISE’S ROOM 2006 Denise and Dev are back in her room hanging out.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: So how'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Well, it wasn’t my all time favorite conversation with my mom, but it was all right. She cried, though.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Oh man.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I figured she would. She’s a crier.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Did she tell you she loves you and supports you no matter what and all that stuff?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: No, man. This ain’t an episode of Growing Pains. She ain't say none of that. But at lease she didn’t disown me, ‘cause that be happening. So... I guess it was a success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine and Joyce are downstairs in the kitchen prepari dinner.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: So, she’s a butch queen?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: (whispering) No. I think that’s something else in the gay world. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 16. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Well, that’s a world I don’t know nothing about, child.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I just wish I knew where I went wrong.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: What do you mean where you went wrong? Denise ain’t never been arrested, she’s in college, she keep a job, and she respects her elders. Honey, she want to lay around with some women, baby that is her business.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Maybe I just should've spent more time with her.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: You spent plenty of time with that girl.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Is this ‘cause I couldn’t keep a man?

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (laughs ) You not being able yo keep a man a whole ‘nother conversation.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: But being gay ain’t got nothing to do with that.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh, I know. I just never thought I would have a gay daughter.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Well, get used to it. ‘Cause one of these days she gone bring home one of her little girlfriends. Catherine cringes at the thought.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh, Lord. Oh Lord! (beat) Well, I just hope she don’t bring home no white girl, ‘cause I don’t want to see no Jennifer Anistons up in here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 17 18 19 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 17. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Oh, honey, Becky is coming. And Megan. And Katie. (laughs) All right, let’s-- I’m gonna finish the peas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine, Ernestine, and Joyce’s Thanksgiving prep. This takes place during Season 1, in 2015.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Girl, it was about to get serious, but I can’t date nobody with a collection of pinkie rings.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Why not? Ain’t nothing wrong with a little jewelry. You were toe rings.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: I dated a pimp once. INT. WATKINS FAMILY APARTMENT - MODERN DENISE’S ROOM - DA 2015

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise and Dev back in the room. Dev is on an Elliptical. Denise is pacing, nervously.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Dev, Dev, get them steps. Dev, Dev, Get them steps. Man, I can’t believe your mom turned your room into a gym. Pretty harsh.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: You know my mom likes to stay fit.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: What time’s Michelle getting here?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: She should be here soon.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: You nervous?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah. It’s the first time my family’s gonna see me with a woman. My grandma don’t really know I’m gay yet, so she still thinks she’s my “friend.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 18. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: All right. Don’t stress. I’m here. It’s gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Have you talked to your parents about Rachel yet?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: They don’t know y’all live together?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I feel like all three of them are gonna get mad at you about that.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Why would they be mad?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Stupid. Just then they hear the DOORBELL RING. They head downstai

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit, here she is. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Michelle in the cut. Dev gets off the Elliptical.

dialogues.speaker: DEV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ooh, my legs are sore. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock at the door. Denise comes down the stairs. Dev follows.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I got it! I got it! (to Dev) Hey, yo, give me a second.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Sure, sure. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 19. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Denise opens the door to greet MICHELLE who walks in hold a bottle of wine. She’s an attractive black woman who wal with confidence.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Hey, boo.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: You’re looking cute.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Mm. Thank you. Denise greets her with an innocent kiss on the cheek. Catherine watches Denise and Michelle from the dining roo pretending to set the table.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thanks for the wine.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You know I have class.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Aunt Joyce gonna love you. Catherine works her way over to the door to meet Michelle

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ma, this is Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Michelle, this in my mom, Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: It’s so great to--

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. Michelle goes for a hug - but Catherine sticks out her ha for a handshake. It turns into an awkward half hug, half handshake. CATHERINE (CONT’D) Yes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 20. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Welcome...

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: To our home.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: That was awkward. Joyce, and Ernestine are standing in a line waiting to me Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh, this is my Aunt Joyce.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s so great to finally meet-- Michelle then goes to shake her hand - but for some reaso Joyce uncomfortably grabs Michelle’s hand. Michelle plays off and turns her one sided handshake into an awkward wav

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: What the hell? Really, Joyce? (beat) Okay, anyway, this is my grandma Ernestine.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Hello, there.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Ooh. Ernestine walks over to Michelle, using her cane, and giv Michelle a warm hug. This is the only greeting that doesn feel weird. Michelle hugs her back and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: This is my friend Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Welcome, darling. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 21. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Okay, Grandma. Dev walks in.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s Dev.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Hey. Friend of Denise’s. No relation to the Watkins.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I figured.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Yeah, the whole me-being-Indian thing probably tipped you off. Fun Denise fact: when we were kids, Denise thought I was black.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Okay. Don’t make me break out the Halloween pictures, all right? Remember when you went as Indian Peter Pan?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Damn, why you got to hate on the Pan? Remember when we were black and Indian Mario and Luigi? That was cute.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Shut up. Joyce notices Michelle’s wine bottle and grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Oh, that look like the expensive shit.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: All right, come on.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: All right, Michelle. I see what you're doing. Hey, yeah!

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Good to meet you, Michelle. Dev and Joyce leave for another room leaving Denise, Catherine, and Michelle to stand around awkwardly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 21 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 22. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Okay. Thanks, Ma.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Get out of here. Catherine leaves. Denise is at a loss for words as she removes Michelle’s coat.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: They're nice.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: They-- they are. They’re great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2015 The family and Dev sit around the table eating Thanksgivi dinner. No one is talking. It’s super awkward. You can he the silverware scraping against the china.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Um, Denise, maybe we can take Michelle to that Chinese restaurant in Flushing I was telling you about.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Yeah, that sounds cool.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Dev, why you plotting your next meal and you ain’t finished the one in front of you?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Never too early to plan ahead, especially when it comes to matters of the tum. Dev clicks his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Well, speaking of Chinese food, Michelle was living in China earlier this year. No one reacts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 23. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A pause. 21

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What to tell them about that, babe?

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, um... I was living in Shanghai for about two months for work. Mostly I just took pictures with people who thought I was Beyoncé. This one restaurant even put my photo up on the wall. I just didn’t have the heart to tell them the truth.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: I’ve always wanted to go to China. Looks cool.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Ma? Aunt Joyce? Grandma? Y’all have any thoughts on that? Joyce and Catherine are still uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Well, you know my hearing is bad. Where did she go?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: China.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: (screaming) China! She went to China, Grandma!

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: (screaming) She lived in Shanghai for two months for work! And a lot of people thought she was Beyoncé! And this one restaurant even put her photo on the wall, but she didn’t have the heart to tell them!

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Oh. I always liked China. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 24, Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: You must be really smart.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: You're smart, and you’re cute. You don’t usually get both of those in the same package. Usually you only get one or the other.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you very much. I could say the same thing about Denise. Denise smiles at Michelle. She instinctively goes in for kiss, but she clocks Catherine’s uneasiness and stops herself. Joyce pours Catherine a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Mm. Joyce takes a pull straight from the bottle. Catherine do her glass and glares at Denise. The room is tense.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: (screaming) Grandma Ernestine, your yams turned out really nice this year! You add a little nutmeg?

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: (screaming) I said your yams turned out really nice this year! Did you add a little nutmeg? Joyce snaps and slams the table.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: She added nutmeg! Don’t you ask another fucking question. Nutmeg, cinnamon, whatever the hell! You know what go in the damn yams!  22 23 24 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 25. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise and Catherine are in the kitchen cleaning up.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I don’t have any appreciation for what was going on at my table.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: If you wanna bring your friend over here, that’s fine, but don’t be making eyes and rubbing backs and getting all fresh.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I wasn’t doing that.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, you were. I saw you. I know that look. Oh, you used to make that look for Rachel from Friends. I always thought you were looking at Joey.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Joey? Ma, are you serious? That character was an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Look, you can be lesbian if you want to - but when you come up in here, you gonna respect my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanksgiving 2016 prep with Catherine, Ernestine, and Joy INT. WATKINS FAMILY APARTMENT - MODERN DENISE’S ROOM - DA 2016 Dev riffles through old VHS tapes in Denise’s room.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Problem Child Two. Oh, shit. What else we got? Denise and Dev's tap dancer song of nineteen ninety-one? Should we fire this up? You remember the routine? Dev starts tapping.

dialogues.speaker: DEV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I don't. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 26. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Man, sit your ass down.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: When's your boo arriving here?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: She should be here in a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Wow. Thanksgiving invite. Must be serious.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Yeah, man. I really like her.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Nice. What's her Instagram name? I want to look her up.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Dude, you're literally gonna meet her in a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: I know. But I want to look it up beforehand, get a vibe.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: (sighs) I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: You forgot, look it up.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: (sighs) NipplesAndToes23.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Whoa. What's that?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: NipplesAndToes23.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Denise! You can't be dating some girl with the Instagram name "NipplesAndToes23."

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I know, man. I'm trying to get her to change it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 27. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: (scoffs) I’m just surprised there are 22 other NipplesAndToes. Dev goes to her Instagram page.

dialogues.speaker: DEV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's see what we got here. Oh, wow. These are some provocative photos.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Okay, don't be looking at my girl, man.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Ooh. Really into fitness. ANGLE ON: Dev’s phone. We see really racy photos of Nikki skimpy gym clothes and drinking thick white protein shake

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: She is kinda naked there.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I shouldn't just paint it with one brush. She's clearly very political. I just voted. Another photo of her with skimpy underwear and panties on with the caption that reads “I just voted.” Denise leans in to see the photo.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Man. That wasn't for no damn election. That was for So You Think You Can Dance?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Does she have some sort of intense fabric allergy ‘cause she is scantily clad ina lot of these photos, Denise. The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: DEV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! NipplesandToes in the building, let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: All right. I'll be there in a second.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Okay. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 25 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 28. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dev heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2016 Everyone is eating Thanksgiving dinner, including NIKKI.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: See that's the thing about Sandra Bland, you know. It's like she reminded me so much of myself. Like, she was woke, she was confident, she didn't take no shit. (sighs) But the scary thing is, that's what got her killed.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: If Sandra was white, we wouldn’t even be having this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Mm. Yeah, you got that right.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: That's why I keep telling y'all, if the police pull you over, just nod your head. A-And shut the fuck up. Nikki is on her phone.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Yo, Dev, what about that Indian grandpa?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. It's big on the Indian people e- mail chains I'm on. So, apparently there was this Indian grandpa in Alabama and he was walking around his neighborhood and some lady called the cops and said, "Oh, there's a black guy walking around." And so the cops are like, "We'll look into it." And they go over there and they try to talk to him and he doesn't speak English. So, he's confused. He hasn't done anything wrong, he tries to walk away. Cop just grabs him, slams him on the ground face first, he's paralyzed now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 29. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. Uh, I think I know the answer to this question. But did anything happen to the cops?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Nope. They said it was a justified use of force.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh. That's horrible. Horrible. A quiet beat.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: So, I was watching the news the other day and apparently there's this bulldog that set a world record for skateboarding through thirty people's legs. DD, you seen that clip. He was going through the legs like... Nikki mimics Otto the Skateboarding dog. The table is stunned by Nikki’s idiocy.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: You know, that wasn't news. That was on Worldstar HipHop.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: That's the news. DD, let's take a selfie.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: All right. Let's do it quick, though. They pose.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Ready? Oh, this has to go on the gram.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Hey, Nikki, what is your username on there?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: NipplesAndToes23. Joyce holds back a spit-take. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” Pink Revision Pages

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Oh. What was it again?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: NipplesAndToes23.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Okay. Well, I'm gonna add you real quick. Wait-- So, NipplesAndToes43.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: No, NipplesAndToes23.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: (typing it in) Nipples and toes twenty-three.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Wait, is it nipples and the letter "N" toes or is it nipples ampersand toes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10/19/16 25 No, it's nipples and the word, "and," a-n- d, toes twenty-three.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: So, nipples, a-n-d toes.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: So, nipples...

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI/DEV
dialogues.text: ...And toes...

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Twenty-three.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI/DEV
dialogues.text: NipplesAndToes23. Joyce slams the table. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 26 27 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 31. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Got the nipples. Got the toes. I 26 think it's very clear what her username is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is watching Do The Right Thing. Nikki is laid ou on a couch.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Hey Dev.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Do you mind scooting to the floor so I can stretch?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Thank you. She sprawls out.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Can you pass me the blanket? Denise grabs her a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: You good?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Ooh. I'm so comfy. So cozy.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm glad you're all cozy and comfy but you mind not talking so much during the movie?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE NIKKI
dialogues.text: Yeah, babe. This is, like, a Sorry. really intense part. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 28 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 32. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: TV, Radio Raheem is lying dead on the ground. Officer Long tells him to “Get the fuck up, boy, or you'r dead!”

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait. One more thing. DD, can you make me your special chocolate milk?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: I'll get your milk. I'm getting up anyway.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: DD, tell him your recipe.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Denise, what’s the recipe?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I just do what's on the back of the bottle, dude.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: (smacks lips) Don’t seem too special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine and Joyce are having a drink as Dev joins them the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Dev, who the hell is this girl?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just met her tonight. But I feel like I've already seen her naked, even though she's fully-clothed.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: She’s a THOT, right?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: What’s a THOT?

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (pointing at Nikki) A T-H-O-T. That. Hoe. Over. There.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Oh, it's an acronym. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 29 30 MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 33. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: You know what, I'm not in love with this whole lesbian thing. But I at least want my child to date a girl who got some sense. What happened to Michelle?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Michelle wanted them to move in together. Denise wasn't ready, they got into a big fight and they broke up.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: That sounds familiar.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Well, shit. I don't believe in shacking either. Mm, mm, mm. Does anybody know why the hell she keep calling Denise "DD?"

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Where is the second "D" coming from? And for the record, I'm about to make this grown woman some chocolate milk. (to Joyce) Fill me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine pulls the turkey out of the oven. Time has adva one year. It is 2017.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dev and Denise talk.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: (handing Dev a glass) Here you go.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Got to say. I'm glad Michelle's coming through this year. We don't have to deal with Nikki. Although, the nickname DD was starting to grow on me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 34. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Okay. Dude, don't ever call me that.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: So, how's everything with Michelle? Things good since you guys got back together?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Yeah, man. It's been really good. We got a couple's therapist now. Learning how to communicate better. Learning about love languages.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Ooh. Love languages.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Yeah, dude. It's a thing. Oh, and we're really on a high right now too 'cause I killed it for her birthday.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: What'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Well, a friend of mine is a chef, right? So he came over and cooked a little nice intimate meal for me and five of her closest friends. Yeah, we lit candles. All that. Super fly.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Mm. I see you.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: You know how I do. But before the night was over, I had New Edition come through and sing her favorite song, "Can You Stand The Rain?"

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: What? How'd you get New Edition?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't get the real New Edition. Got the New Edition cover band, New Addition. A-d-d-i-t-i-o-n.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Love the name. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: A32
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 35. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Yeah. The Filipino Johnny Gill was no joke. Yeah. The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, I should go. 31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: New Edition - Can You Stand the Rain? MONTAGE: Denise opens the door for Michelle. They hug. Th family and Dev are happy to see Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine is prepping Thanksgiving alone. Michelle walks

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: So Dev and Denise never help out with the cooking?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Unless you count Dev’s macaroni taste test, then no.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Well, I’d love to help. Catherine pauses for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh... Well, uh, grab that platter and plate some of the cornbread for me. There is an awkward beat of silence

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I like that outfit you got Denise.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, um, it's nice to mix it up so she's not always wearing sweatpants and a hat that says “Ratch.”

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... I remember when she was in the eighth grade, she wore a John Starks Knicks jersey to school the whole year. Then she spilled gravy all over it and she still wore it for another month. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 36. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had to sneak up in her room and take it to give it to the Goodwill.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: Ooh. Well, that's good to know. I might just have to spill some gravy on that “Ratch” hat. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I know that’s right. They laugh. Denise enters.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: What y'all in here laughing about?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Don't you worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna take this out. Michelle exits.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Thank you. (to Denise) I think this is gonna to be a lovely Thanksgiving, Denise.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think so.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: And, uh, I like Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: I like her, too. Catherine holds Denise’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I’m happy for you. Denise smiles. Dev walks over.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Guys, I just got a text from Nikki. Um, she's kicking it with that bulldog that skateboards through people's legs, they're close by, wondering if they can roll through. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] 37. Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: DD, you wanna get the chocolate milk ready?

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Okay. So, I'm just not gonna live that down, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Hey, I was nice to her. I made her chocolate milk.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you ain't do the right recipe though. You messed up the ratio. You put too much of the powder in there. They walk out together to join the rest of the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is seated for Thanksgiving dinner.

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE
dialogues.text: So Dev, do you come over for every Thanksgiving?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. He's here every year. Since he was a little boy, the two of them playing upstairs with toys...

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Oh. Then when they was teenagers, smoking weed and playing ‘intendo.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Oh, please. I found one of your sad little blunts in the trash. It was depressing. I smoked it though. Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: Wait, so guys knew?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Coming down to dinner all bug-eyed and smelling like lemon air freshener, thinking y’all was slick? Please. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASTER OF NONE “Thanksgiving” [208] Pink Revision Pages 10/19/16

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: What are y’all laughing about?

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (to Dev) Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: DEV
dialogues.text: (yelling) So, Grandma! When we were teenagers we used to go upstairs and smoke weed and we didn't think they knew, but they did!

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTINE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I remember that. The whole house smelled like reefer. They continue to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Can we say grace? 34 Cut to black.
